caption:
The photograph depicts a serene, expansive aerial view of a landscape dominated by forests and a large body of water. From this high vantage point, the water appears calm with slight ripples creating a textured surface that reflects the surrounding environment. The shoreline is irregular, with points and coves that penetrate the dense treeline. 

The forest is thick and predominantly evergreen, indicating a potentially temperate climate. The trees are closely packed, covering undulating terrain that stretches across the entirety of the visible landscape. The green hue of the forest is monochrome and deep, suggesting either a late day or a filter effect on the photograph.

On the near side of the lake, slightly left of the center, smoke or steam is visible, rising from a small cleared area in the forest, indicating human activity. There appears to be a small, possibly man-made, clearing where this activity is centered.

In the distance, beyond the immediate expanse of the forest and body of water, the terrain rises slightly before fading into a hazy horizon. There are no visible structures or other signs of urban development in the immediate vicinity, which gives the scene a remote or secluded feel. The overall impression is one of tranquility and natural beauty, undisturbed by extensive human interaction beyond the small area of activity noted.
title: Aerial view looking southeast at the Navy's Bangor Annex waterfront at its Cattail Lake area. The Navy is building a new Trident submarine base which calls for extensive construction to support the boats. When completed the expected population growth will affect the lives of humans and animals living nearby.
